summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The City of Dallas Community Police Oversight Board (CPOB) will hold a regular meeting on January 14, 2025, at 5:30 PM. The meeting aims to address community concerns regarding police oversight, review ongoing initiatives, and enhance transparency within the Dallas Police Department (DPD).

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Call to Order and Roll Call  
2. Purpose of the CPOB  
3. Public Comment/Open Microphone session  
4. Approval of previous meeting minutes  
5. Presentation on racial disparity in DPD arrests  
6. Overview of the OCPO Accountability and Transparency Dashboard  
7. Introduction of new OCPO staff  
8. Reports from the Director, Policy Analyst, and Special Investigator  
9. Consideration of independent reviews for specific cases  
10. Approval of the CPOB Annual Report  

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will feature a presentation by Bob Scales on racial disparities in DPD monthly arrests, utilizing data from various reporting systems. Additionally, the OCPO will present a new Transparency & Accountability Dashboard designed to provide insights into complaints against the DPD, aiming to foster trust within the community. Legislative updates regarding Senate Bill 281 and House Bill 881 will also be discussed.

**Action Items**:  
The board will seek approval for the minutes from the previous meeting, the CPOB Annual Report, and votes on independent reviews for specific cases. Public comments will be welcomed, and members will have the opportunity to discuss their reports and community engagement initiatives.
